016package org.lifstools.jgoslin.parser;
017
018import org.lifstools.jgoslin.domain.LipidParsingException;
019import org.lifstools.jgoslin.domain.StringFunctions;
020import java.util.ArrayDeque;
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.HashMap;
023import java.util.HashSet;
024import java.util.Map.Entry;
025import java.util.Optional;
026import org.lifstools.jgoslin.domain.ConstraintViolationException;
027
028/**
029 * Abstract base class for parsers producing a parse result of type T. Uses a
030 * re-implementation of Cocke-Younger-Kasami (CYK) algorithm for context free
031 * grammars.
032 *
033 * @author Dominik Kopczynski
034 * @author Nils Hoffmann
035 * @param <T> the type of a successful parse result.
036 */
037public abstract class Parser<T> {
038
039    // DP stands for dynamic programming
040    protected final class DPNode {
041
042        public long rule_index_1;
043        public long rule_index_2;
044        public DPNode left = null;
045        public DPNode right = null;
046
047        public DPNode(long _rule1, long _rule2, DPNode _left, DPNode _right) {
048            rule_index_1 = _rule1;
049            rule_index_2 = _rule2;
050            left = _left;
051            right = _right;
052        }
053    }
054
055    enum Context {
056        NoContext, InLineComment, InLongComment, InQuote
057    };
058
059    enum MatchWords {
060        NoMatch, LineCommentStart, LineCommentEnd, LongCommentStart, LongCommentEnd, Quote
061    };
062
063    protected static final int SHIFT = 32;
064    protected static final long MASK = (1L << SHIFT) - 1;
065    protected static final char RULE_ASSIGNMENT = ':';
066    protected static final char RULE_SEPARATOR = '|';
067    protected static final char RULE_TERMINAL = ';';
068    protected static final char EOF_SIGN = (char) 1;
069    protected static final long EOF_RULE = 1L;
070    protected static final long START_RULE = 2L;
071    protected static final String EOF_RULE_NAME = "EOF";
072
073    protected long nextFreeRuleIndex;
074    protected final HashMap<Character, HashSet<Long>> TtoNT = new HashMap<>();
075    protected final HashMap<Character, Long> originalTtoNT = new HashMap<>();
076    protected final HashMap<String, Long> ruleToNT = new HashMap<>();
077    protected final HashMap<Long, HashSet<Long>> NTtoNT = new HashMap<>();
078    protected final HashMap<Long, String> NTtoRule = new HashMap<>();
079    protected final HashMap<Long, ArrayList<Long>> substitution = new HashMap<>();
080    protected final ArrayList<Bitfield> rightPair = new ArrayList<>();
081    protected int avgPair;
082    protected char quote;
083    protected String grammarName = "";
084    protected boolean usedEof = false;
085    protected static final char DEFAULT_QUOTE = '\'';
086
087    public Parser(String grammarContent) {
088        this(grammarContent, (char) '\0');
089    }
090
091    public Parser(String grammarContent, char _quote) {
092        this.quote = (_quote != 0) ? _quote : DEFAULT_QUOTE;
093        readGrammar(grammarContent);
094    }
095
096    public abstract BaseParserEventHandler<T> newEventHandler();
097
098    protected long get_next_free_rule_index() {
099        if (nextFreeRuleIndex <= MASK) {
100            return nextFreeRuleIndex++;
101        }
102        throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: grammar is too big.");
103    }
104
105    protected final void readGrammar(String grammar) {
106        nextFreeRuleIndex = START_RULE;
107        grammarName = "";
108        usedEof = false;
109
110        // interpret the rules and create the structure for parsing
111        ArrayList<String> rules = extract_text_based_rules(grammar, quote);
112        ArrayList<String> tokens = StringFunctions.splitString(rules.get(0), ' ', quote);
113        grammarName = tokens.get(1);
114
115        rules.remove(0);
116        ruleToNT.put(EOF_RULE_NAME, EOF_RULE);
117        TtoNT.put(EOF_SIGN, new HashSet<>());
118        TtoNT.get(EOF_SIGN).add(EOF_RULE);
119
120        for (String rule_line : rules) {
121            ArrayList<String> tokens_level_1 = new ArrayList<>();
122            ArrayList<String> line_tokens = StringFunctions.splitString(rule_line, RULE_ASSIGNMENT, quote);
123            for (String t : line_tokens) {
124                tokens_level_1.add(StringFunctions.strip(t, ' '));
125            }
126
127            if (tokens_level_1.size() != 2) {
128                throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: corrupted token in grammar rule: '" + rule_line + "'");
129            }
130
131            ArrayList<String> rule_tokens = StringFunctions.splitString(tokens_level_1.get(0), ' ', quote);
132            if (rule_tokens.size() > 1) {
133                throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: several rule names on left hand side in grammar rule: '" + rule_line + "'");
134            }
135            String rule = tokens_level_1.get(0);
136
137            if (rule.equals(EOF_RULE_NAME)) {
138                throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: rule name is not allowed to be called EOF");
139            }
140
141            ArrayList<String> products = StringFunctions.splitString(tokens_level_1.get(1), RULE_SEPARATOR, quote);
142            for (int i = 0; i < products.size(); ++i) {
143                products.set(i, StringFunctions.strip(products.get(i), ' '));
144            }
145
146            if (!ruleToNT.containsKey(rule)) {
147                ruleToNT.put(rule, get_next_free_rule_index());
148            }
149            long new_rule_index = ruleToNT.get(rule);
150
151            if (!NTtoRule.containsKey(new_rule_index)) {
152                NTtoRule.put(new_rule_index, rule);
153            }
154
155            for (String product : products) {
156                ArrayList<String> non_terminals = new ArrayList<>();
157                ArrayDeque<Long> non_terminal_rules = new ArrayDeque<>();
158                ArrayList<String> product_rules = StringFunctions.splitString(product, ' ', quote);
159                for (String NT : product_rules) {
160                    String stripedNT = StringFunctions.strip(NT, ' ');
161                    if (is_terminal(stripedNT, quote)) {
162                        stripedNT = de_escape(stripedNT, quote);
163                    }
164                    non_terminals.add(stripedNT);
165                    usedEof |= (stripedNT.equals(EOF_RULE_NAME));
166                }
167
168                String NTFirst = non_terminals.get(0);
169                if (non_terminals.size() > 1 || !is_terminal(NTFirst, quote) || NTFirst.length() != 3) {
170                    for (String non_terminal : non_terminals) {
171                        if (is_terminal(non_terminal, quote)) {
172                            non_terminal_rules.add(add_terminal(non_terminal));
173                        } else {
174                            if (!ruleToNT.containsKey(non_terminal)) {
175                                ruleToNT.put(non_terminal, get_next_free_rule_index());
176                            }
177                            non_terminal_rules.add(ruleToNT.get(non_terminal));
178                        }
179                    }
180                } else {
181                    char c = NTFirst.charAt(1);
182                    long tRule = 0;
183                    if (!TtoNT.containsKey(c)) {
184                        tRule = get_next_free_rule_index();
185                        TtoNT.put(c, new HashSet<>());
186                        TtoNT.get(c).add(tRule);
187
188                    } else {
189                        tRule = (new ArrayList<>(TtoNT.get(c))).get(0);
190                    }
191
192                    if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(tRule)) {
193                        NTtoNT.put(tRule, new HashSet<>());
194                    }
195                    NTtoNT.get(tRule).add(new_rule_index);
196                }
197
198                // more than two rules, insert intermediate rule indexes
199                while (non_terminal_rules.size() > 2) {
200                    long rule_index_2 = non_terminal_rules.pollLast();
201                    long rule_index_1 = non_terminal_rules.pollLast();
202
203                    long key = compute_rule_key(rule_index_1, rule_index_2);
204                    long next_index = get_next_free_rule_index();
205                    if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(key)) {
206                        NTtoNT.put(key, new HashSet<>());
207                    }
208                    NTtoNT.get(key).add(next_index);
209                    non_terminal_rules.add(next_index);
210                }
211
212                // two product rules
213                if (non_terminal_rules.size() == 2) {
214                    long rule_index_2 = non_terminal_rules.pollLast();
215                    long rule_index_1 = non_terminal_rules.pollLast();
216                    long key = compute_rule_key(rule_index_1, rule_index_2);
217                    if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(key)) {
218                        NTtoNT.put(key, new HashSet<>());
219                    }
220                    NTtoNT.get(key).add(new_rule_index);
221                } // only one product rule
222                else if (non_terminal_rules.size() == 1) {
223                    long rule_index_1 = non_terminal_rules.pollLast();
224                    if (rule_index_1 == new_rule_index) {
225                        throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: corrupted token in grammar: rule '" + rule + "' is not allowed to refer soleley to itself.");
226                    }
227
228                    if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(rule_index_1)) {
229                        NTtoNT.put(rule_index_1, new HashSet<>());
230                    }
231                    NTtoNT.get(rule_index_1).add(new_rule_index);
232                }
233            }
234        }
235
236        // keeping the original terminal dictionary
237        for (Entry<Character, HashSet<Long>> kv : TtoNT.entrySet()) {
238            for (long rule : kv.getValue()) {
239                originalTtoNT.put(kv.getKey(), rule);
240                break;
241            }
242        }
243
244        // creating substitution dictionary for adding single rule chains into the parsing tree
245        HashSet<Long> visited = new HashSet<>();
246        for (Entry<Long, HashSet<Long>> kv : NTtoNT.entrySet()) {
247            HashSet<Long> values = new HashSet<>();
248            values.add(kv.getKey());
249            for (long rule : values) {
250                if (visited.contains(rule)) {
251                    continue;
252                }
253                visited.add(rule);
254
255                ArrayList<Long> topnodes = collect_one_backwards(rule);
256                for (long rule_top : topnodes) {
257                    ArrayList< ArrayList<Long>> chains = collect_backwards(rule, rule_top);
258
259                    for (ArrayList<Long> cchain : chains) {
260                        ArrayList<Long> chain = cchain;
261                        while (chain.size() > 1) {
262                            long top = chain.get(0);
263                            chain.remove(0);
264                            long key = kv.getKey() + (top << 16);
265                            if (!substitution.containsKey(key)) {
266                                substitution.put(key, chain);
267
268                                if (chain.size() > 1) {
269                                    ArrayList<Long> new_chain = new ArrayList<>();
270                                    for (long e : chain) {
271                                        new_chain.add(e);
272                                    }
273                                    chain = new_chain;
274                                }
275                            } else {
276                                break;
277                            }
278                        }
279                    }
280                }
281            }
282        }
283
284        // expanding terminal dictionary for single rule chains
285        HashSet<Character> keys = new HashSet<>();
286        for (Entry<Character, HashSet<Long>> key : TtoNT.entrySet()) {
287            keys.add(key.getKey());
288        }
289        for (char c : keys) {
290            HashSet<Long> k_rules = new HashSet<>();
291            for (long rule : TtoNT.get(c)) {
292                k_rules.add(rule);
293            }
294
295            for (long rule : k_rules) {
296                ArrayList<Long> backward_rules = collect_one_backwards(rule);
297                for (long p : backward_rules) {
298                    TtoNT.get(c).add(p);
299                }
300            }
301        }
302
303        // expanding non-terminal dictionary for single rule chains
304        HashSet<Long> keysNT = new HashSet<>();
305        for (Entry<Long, HashSet<Long>> k : NTtoNT.entrySet()) {
306            keysNT.add(k.getKey());
307        }
308        for (long r : keysNT) {
309            HashSet<Long> k_rules = new HashSet<>();
310            for (long rr : NTtoNT.get(r)) {
311                k_rules.add(rr);
312            }
313
314            for (long rule : k_rules) {
315                ArrayList<Long> backward_rules = collect_one_backwards(rule);
316                for (long p : backward_rules) {
317                    NTtoNT.get(r).add(p);
318                }
319            }
320        }
321
322        // creating lookup table for right index pairs to a given left index
323        for (long i = 0; i < nextFreeRuleIndex; ++i) {
324            rightPair.add(new Bitfield((int) nextFreeRuleIndex));
325        }
326
327        for (Entry<Long, HashSet<Long>> kv : NTtoNT.entrySet()) {
328            if (kv.getKey() <= MASK) {
329                continue;
330            }
331            rightPair.get((int) ((kv.getKey() >>> SHIFT))).add((int) (kv.getKey() & MASK));
332        }
333    }
334
335    protected ArrayList<String> extract_text_based_rules(String grammar, char _quote) {
336        ArrayList<String> rules = null;
337        int grammar_length = grammar.length();
338
339        /*
340        deleting comments to prepare for splitting the grammar in rules.
341        Therefore, we have to consider three different contexts, namely
342        within a quote, within a line comment, within a long comment.
343        As long as we are in one context, key words for starting / ending
344        the other contexts have to be ignored.
345         */
346        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
347        Context current_context = Context.NoContext;
348        int current_position = 0;
349        int last_escaped_backslash = -1;
350
351        for (int i = 0; i < grammar_length - 1; ++i) {
352            MatchWords match = MatchWords.NoMatch;
353
354            if (i > 0 && grammar.charAt(i) == '\\' && grammar.charAt(i - 1) == '\\' && last_escaped_backslash != i - 1) {
355                last_escaped_backslash = i;
356                continue;
357            }
358
359            if (grammar.charAt(i) == '/' && grammar.charAt(i + 1) == '/') {
360                match = MatchWords.LineCommentStart;
361            } else if (grammar.charAt(i) == '\n') {
362                match = MatchWords.LineCommentEnd;
363            } else if (grammar.charAt(i) == '/' && grammar.charAt(i + 1) == '*') {
364                match = MatchWords.LongCommentStart;
365            } else if (grammar.charAt(i) == '*' && grammar.charAt(i + 1) == '/') {
366                match = MatchWords.LongCommentEnd;
367            } else if (grammar.charAt(i) == _quote && !(i >= 1 && grammar.charAt(i - 1) == '\\' && i - 1 != last_escaped_backslash)) {
368                match = MatchWords.Quote;
369            }
370
371            if (match != MatchWords.NoMatch) {
372                switch (current_context) {
373                    case NoContext:
374                        switch (match) {
375                            case LongCommentStart:
376                                sb.append(grammar.substring(current_position, i));
377                                current_context = Context.InLongComment;
378                                break;
379
380                            case LineCommentStart:
381                                sb.append(grammar.substring(current_position, i));
382                                current_context = Context.InLineComment;
383                                break;
384
385                            case Quote:
386                                current_context = Context.InQuote;
387                                break;
388
389                            default:
390                                break;
391                        }
392                        break;
393
394                    case InQuote:
395                        if (match == MatchWords.Quote) {
396                            current_context = Context.NoContext;
397                        }
398                        break;
399
400                    case InLineComment:
401                        if (match == MatchWords.LineCommentEnd) {
402                            current_context = Context.NoContext;
403                            current_position = i + 1;
404                        }
405                        break;
406
407                    case InLongComment:
408                        if (match == MatchWords.LongCommentEnd) {
409                            current_context = Context.NoContext;
410                            current_position = i + 2;
411                        }
412                        break;
413
414                    default:
415                        break;
416                }
417            }
418        }
419
420        if (current_context == Context.NoContext) {
421            sb.append(grammar.substring(current_position, grammar_length));
422        } else {
423            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: corrupted grammar, ends either in comment or quote");
424        }
425
426        grammar = sb.toString();
427        grammar = grammar.replace("\r\n", "");
428        grammar = grammar.replace("\n", "");
429        grammar = grammar.replace("\r", "");
430        grammar = StringFunctions.strip(grammar, ' ');
431
432        if (grammar.charAt(grammar.length() - 1) != RULE_TERMINAL) {
433            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: corrupted grammar, last rule has no termininating sign, was: '" + grammar.substring(grammar.length() - 1) + "'");
434        }
435
436        rules = StringFunctions.splitString(grammar, RULE_TERMINAL, _quote);
437
438        if (rules.size() < 1) {
439            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: corrupted grammar, grammar is empty");
440        }
441        ArrayList<String> grammar_name_rule = StringFunctions.splitString(rules.get(0), ' ', _quote);
442
443        if (grammar_name_rule.size() > 0 && !grammar_name_rule.get(0).equals("grammar")) {
444            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: first rule must start with the keyword 'grammar'");
445        } else if (grammar_name_rule.size() != 2) {
446            throw new ConstraintViolationException("Error: incorrect first rule");
447        }
448
449        return rules;
450    }
451
452    protected long compute_rule_key(long rule_index_1, long rule_index_2) {
453        return (rule_index_1 << SHIFT) | rule_index_2;
454    }
455
456    // checking if string is terminal
457    protected boolean is_terminal(String product_token, char _quote) {
458        return product_token.charAt(0) == _quote && product_token.charAt(product_token.length() - 1) == _quote && product_token.length() > 2;
459    }
460
461    protected String de_escape(String text, char _quote) {
462        // remove the escape chars
463        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
464        boolean last_escape_char = false;
465        for (int i = 0; i < text.length(); ++i) {
466            char c = text.charAt(i);
467            boolean escape_char = false;
468
469            if (c != '\\') {
470                sb.append(c);
471            } else {
472                if (!last_escape_char) {
473                    escape_char = true;
474                } else {
475                    sb.append(c);
476                }
477            }
478
479            last_escape_char = escape_char;
480
481        }
482        return sb.toString();
483    }
484
485    // splitting the whole terminal in a tree structure where characters of terminal are the leafs and the inner nodes are added non terminal rules
486    protected long add_terminal(String text) {
487        ArrayDeque<Long> terminal_rules = new ArrayDeque<>();
488        for (int i = 1; i < text.length() - 1; ++i) {
489            char c = text.charAt(i);
490            long tRule = 0;
491            if (!TtoNT.containsKey(c)) {
492                tRule = get_next_free_rule_index();
493                TtoNT.put(c, new HashSet<>());
494                TtoNT.get(c).add(tRule);
495            } else {
496                tRule = (new ArrayList<>(TtoNT.get(c))).get(0);
497            }
498            terminal_rules.add(tRule);
499        }
500
501        while (terminal_rules.size() > 1) {
502            long rule_index_2 = terminal_rules.pollLast();
503            long rule_index_1 = terminal_rules.pollLast();
504            long next_index = get_next_free_rule_index();
505
506            long key = compute_rule_key(rule_index_1, rule_index_2);
507            if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(key)) {
508                NTtoNT.put(key, new HashSet<>());
509            }
510            NTtoNT.get(key).add(next_index);
511            terminal_rules.add(next_index);
512        }
513        return terminal_rules.pollLast();
514    }
515
516    protected ArrayList<Long> top_nodes(long rule_index) {
517        ArrayList<Long> collection = new ArrayList<>();
518        ArrayList<Long> collection_top = new ArrayList<>();
519        collection.add(rule_index);
520        int i = 0;
521        while (i < collection.size()) {
522            long current_index = collection.get(i);
523            if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(current_index)) {
524                for (long previous_index : NTtoNT.get(current_index)) {
525                    collection.add(previous_index);
526                }
527            } else {
528                collection_top.add(current_index);
529            }
530            ++i;
531        }
532
533        return collection_top;
534    }
535
536    // expanding singleton rules, e.g. S . A, A . B, B . C
537    protected ArrayList<Long> collect_one_backwards(Long rule_index) {
538        ArrayList<Long> collection = new ArrayList<>();
539        collection.add(rule_index);
540        int i = 0;
541        while (i < collection.size()) {
542            long current_index = collection.get(i);
543            if (NTtoNT.containsKey(current_index)) {
544                for (long previous_index : NTtoNT.get(current_index)) {
545                    collection.add(previous_index);
546                }
547            }
548            ++i;
549        }
550
551        return collection;
552    }
553
554    protected ArrayList< ArrayList<Long>> collect_backwards(Long child_rule_index, Long parent_rule_index) {
555        HashSet<Long> visited = new HashSet<>();
556        ArrayList<Long> path = new ArrayList<>();
557        ArrayList< ArrayList<Long>> collection = new ArrayList<>();
558
559        return collect_backwards(child_rule_index, parent_rule_index, visited, path, collection);
560    }
561
562    protected ArrayList< ArrayList<Long>> collect_backwards(long child_rule_index, long parent_rule_index, HashSet<Long> visited, ArrayList<Long> path, ArrayList< ArrayList<Long>> collection) {
563        // provides all single linkage paths from a child rule to a parent rule,
564        // and yes, there can be several paths
565
566        if (!NTtoNT.containsKey(child_rule_index)) {
567            return collection;
568        }
569
570        visited.add(child_rule_index);
571        path.add(child_rule_index);
572
573        for (long previous_rule : NTtoNT.get(child_rule_index)) {
574            if (!visited.contains(previous_rule)) {
575                if (previous_rule == parent_rule_index) {
576                    ArrayList<Long> found_path = new ArrayList<>();
577                    found_path.add(parent_rule_index);
578                    for (int i = path.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
579                        found_path.add(path.get(i));
580                    }
581                    collection.add(found_path);
582                } else {
583                    collection = collect_backwards(previous_rule, parent_rule_index, visited, path, collection);
584                }
585            }
586        }
587        path.remove(path.size() - 1);
588        visited.remove(child_rule_index);
589
590        return collection;
591    }
592
593    protected void raise_events(TreeNode node, BaseParserEventHandler parserEventHandler) {
594        if (node != null) {
595            String node_rule_name = node.fire_event ? NTtoRule.get(node.rule_index) : "";
596            if (node.fire_event) {
597                parserEventHandler.handleEvent(node_rule_name + "_pre_event", node);
598            }
599
600            if (node.left != null) { // node.terminal is != None when node is leaf
601                raise_events(node.left, parserEventHandler);
602                if (node.right != null) {
603                    raise_events(node.right, parserEventHandler);
604                }
605            }
606
607            if (node.fire_event) {
608                parserEventHandler.handleEvent(node_rule_name + "_post_event", node);
609            }
610        }
611    }
612
613    // filling the syntax tree including events
614    protected void fill_tree(TreeNode node, DPNode dp_node) {
615        // checking and extending nodes for single rule chains
616
617        long bottom_rule = 0, top_rule = 0;
618        if (dp_node.left != null) {
619            bottom_rule = compute_rule_key(dp_node.rule_index_1, dp_node.rule_index_2);
620            top_rule = node.rule_index;
621        } else {
622            top_rule = dp_node.rule_index_2;
623            bottom_rule = originalTtoNT.get((char) dp_node.rule_index_1);
624        }
625
626        long subst_key = bottom_rule + (top_rule << 16);
627
628        if ((bottom_rule != top_rule) && (substitution.containsKey(subst_key))) {
629            for (long rule_index : substitution.get(subst_key)) {
630                node.left = new TreeNode(rule_index, NTtoRule.containsKey(rule_index));
631                node = node.left;
632            }
633        }
634
635        if (dp_node.left != null) { // None => leaf
636            node.left = new TreeNode(dp_node.rule_index_1, NTtoRule.containsKey(dp_node.rule_index_1));
637            node.right = new TreeNode(dp_node.rule_index_2, NTtoRule.containsKey(dp_node.rule_index_2));
638            fill_tree(node.left, dp_node.left);
639            fill_tree(node.right, dp_node.right);
640        } else {
641            // I know, it is not 100% clean to store the character in an integer
642            // especially when it is not the dedicated attribute for, but the heck with it!
643            node.terminal = (char) dp_node.rule_index_1;
644        }
645    }
646
647    /**
648     * Parse the given text, constructing the output object of type T using the
649     * provided parser event handler.
650     *
651     * @param textToParse the text to parse.
652     * @param parserEventHandler the parser event handler to process events
653     * created by the parser.
654     * @return the parsed object of type T if successful, otherwise an exception
655     * will be thrown.
656     * @throws LipidParsingException
657     */
658    public T parse(String textToParse, BaseParserEventHandler<T> parserEventHandler) {
659        return parse(textToParse, parserEventHandler, true);
660    }
661
662    /**
663     * Parse the given text, constructing the output object of type T using the
664     * provided parser event handler.Allows the user to specify, if exceptions
665     * should be thrown on errors.
666     *
667     * @param textToParse the text to parse.
668     * @param parserEventHandler the parser event handler to process events
669     * created by the parser.
670     * @param throwError if true, throws exception if parsing was not
671     * successful.
672     * @return the parsed object of type T if successful, otherwise {@code null}, if throwError is {@code false}.
673     */
674    public T parse(String textToParse, BaseParserEventHandler<T> parserEventHandler, boolean throwError) {
675        String old_text = textToParse;
676        
677        if (usedEof) {
678            textToParse += EOF_SIGN;
679        }
680        parserEventHandler.content = null;
681
682        // adding all rule names into the event handler
683        for (Entry<String, Long> rule_name : ruleToNT.entrySet()) {
684            parserEventHandler.ruleNames.add(rule_name.getKey());
685        }
686
687        parserEventHandler.sanityCheck(this);
688        try {
689            Optional<ParsingErrors> parsingErrors = parse_regular(textToParse, parserEventHandler);
690            if (parsingErrors.isPresent() && !parsingErrors.get().wordInGrammar) {
691                if (throwError) {
692                    throw new LipidParsingException("Token '" + old_text + "' can not be parsed by grammar '" + grammarName + "'");
693                } else {
694                    parserEventHandler.errorMessage = parsingErrors.get().errorMessage;
695                }
696            }
697        } catch (RuntimeException lpe) {
698            if (throwError) {
699                throw new LipidParsingException("Token '" + old_text + "' can not be parsed by grammar '" + grammarName + "': ", lpe);
700            } else {
701                parserEventHandler.errorMessage = lpe.getLocalizedMessage();
702            }
703        }
704        return parserEventHandler.content;
705    }
706
707    protected class ParsingErrors {
708
709        final boolean wordInGrammar;
710        final String errorMessage;
711
712        ParsingErrors(boolean wordInGrammar, String errorMessage) {
713            this.wordInGrammar = wordInGrammar;
714            this.errorMessage = errorMessage;
715        }
716
717    }
718
719    protected Optional<ParsingErrors> parse_regular(String text_to_parse, BaseParserEventHandler<T> parserEventHandler) {
720        boolean wordInGrammar = false;
721
722        int n = text_to_parse.length();
723        // dp stands for dynamic programming, nothing else
724        ArrayList< ArrayList< HashMap<Long, DPNode>>> DP = new ArrayList<>();
725
726        // Ks is a lookup, which fields in the DP are filled
727        Bitfield[] Ks = new Bitfield[n];
728
729        // init the tables
730        for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
731            ArrayList< HashMap<Long, DPNode>> list = new ArrayList<>();
732            for (int j = 0; j < n - i; ++j) {
733                list.add(new HashMap<>());
734            }
735            DP.add(list);
736            Ks[i] = new Bitfield(n);
737        }
738
739        boolean requirement_fulfilled = true;
740        for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
741            char c = text_to_parse.charAt(i);
742            if (!TtoNT.containsKey(c)) {
743                requirement_fulfilled = false;
744                break;
745            }
746
747            for (long T_rule_index : TtoNT.get(c)) {
748                DPNode dp_node = new DPNode(c, T_rule_index, null, null);
749                DP.get(i).get(0).put(T_rule_index, dp_node);
750            }
751            Ks[i].add(0);
752        }
753
754        if (requirement_fulfilled) {
755            for (int i = 1; i < n; ++i) {
756                int im1 = i - 1;
757
758                for (int j = 0; j < n - i; ++j) {
759
760                    ArrayList< HashMap<Long, DPNode>> DPj = DP.get(j);
761                    HashMap<Long, DPNode> DPji = DPj.get(i);
762                    int jp1 = j + 1;
763
764                    Ks[j].resetIterator();
765                    while (Ks[j].hasNext()) {
766                        int k = Ks[j].next();
767                        int jpok = jp1 + k;
768                        int im1mk = im1 - k;
769                        if (Ks[jpok].find(im1mk)) {
770                            for (Entry<Long, DPNode> index_pair_1 : DP.get(j).get(k).entrySet()) {
771                                Bitfield b = rightPair.get((int) (long) index_pair_1.getKey());
772                                for (Entry<Long, DPNode> index_pair_2 : DP.get(jpok).get(im1mk).entrySet()) {
773                                    if (b.find((int) (long) index_pair_2.getKey())) {
774                                        long key = compute_rule_key(index_pair_1.getKey(), index_pair_2.getKey());
775
776                                        DPNode content = new DPNode(index_pair_1.getKey(), index_pair_2.getKey(), index_pair_1.getValue(), index_pair_2.getValue());
777                                        for (long rule_index : NTtoNT.get(key)) {
778                                            if (!DPji.containsKey(rule_index)) {
779                                                DPji.put(rule_index, content);
780                                            }
781                                        }
782                                    }
783                                }
784                            }
785                        }
786
787                    }
788                    if (DPji.size() > 0) {
789                        Ks[j].add(i);
790                    }
791                }
792            }
793
794            for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; --i) {
795                if (DP.get(0).get(i).containsKey(START_RULE)) {
796                    wordInGrammar = true;
797                    TreeNode parse_tree = new TreeNode(START_RULE, NTtoRule.containsKey(START_RULE));
798                    fill_tree(parse_tree, DP.get(0).get(i).get(START_RULE));
799                    raise_events(parse_tree, parserEventHandler);
800                    break;
801                }
802            }
803
804            if (!wordInGrammar) {
805                for (int i = n - 1; i > 0; --i) {
806                    if (DP.get(0).get(i).size() > 0) {
807                        long first_rule = DP.get(0).get(i).keySet().iterator().next();
808
809                        TreeNode parse_tree = new TreeNode(first_rule, NTtoRule.containsKey(first_rule));
810                        fill_tree(parse_tree, DP.get(0).get(i).get(first_rule));
811                        return Optional.of(new ParsingErrors(wordInGrammar, parse_tree.getText()));
812                    }
813                }
814            }
815        }
816        return Optional.empty();
817    }
818}
